clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Lipid Modifying Drugs on HDL Function in Patients With Hyperlipidemia

brief_summary.textblock: 1) to test HDL function comprehensively in healthy and diseased individuals; 2) to evaluate if this test correlates with cardiovascular risk, independent of traditional risk factors; 3) and to differentiate effects of lipid-modifying or antiatherosclerotic drugs on HDL function and composition

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The patients who meet the 2013 American College of Cardiology/American Heart Association criteria for receiving lipid-lowering therapy
- Aged over 20
- Consent form signed
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnant or lactating women
- subjects with familial hypercholesterolemia
- uncontrolled hypertension or DM
- Thyroid dysfunction
- Active liver disease (transaminase or bilirubin > 1.5 x NL)
- Serum creatinine > 2 mg/dL
- Included in other clinical trials within 3 months
- using of other medication: fish oil, fibric acid derivatives, niacin, systemic corticosteroid, thiazolidinedione
